mjo_stdlib LOCAL mjo_stdlib

NAME

mjo_abort — abnormally terminate the current process

SYNOPSIS

#include <mstdlib.h>

void
mjo_abort(int const i_ecode);

DESCRIPTION

mjo_abort() is a macro, which calls mjo_mem_abort() to print a small amount of diagnostic information and then terminate the current process via a call to abort(3).

Following is a description of the arguments.

i_ecode
errno or an application code

If i_ecode is zero, it will not be evaluated.

If i_ecode is not zero and is not a valid system code, the error code shall be printed.

If i_ecode is a valid system error code the error code and message string shall be printed.

NOTES

The function and line number of the calling routine shall be printed. The diagnostic information is followed by an error code and possibly the message string.

A call to streror(2) is analyzed to determine if the error code is a system or application code.

System error codes are defined in <errno.h>.

SEE ALSO

abort(3) strerror(2)

EXAMPLES

#include <errno.h>
#include <stdint.h>
/**/
#include <mstdlib.h>

int
  main()
{
  int rc;
  size_t result;

  rc = mjo_add_size_t(&result, SIZE_MAX, 1);

  if (rc)
    {
      mjo_abort(errno);
    }

  return rc;
}

OUTPUT

ABORT:          Function: /home/devel/mjo/examples/abort.c (26)
                errno: Result too large (34)
Abort trap (core dumped)

SOURCE

${MJO_HOME}/examples/abort.c
July 22, 2020 OpenBSD 7.0
